full_summary:
**Title:** Professional Services for Hybrid and Electric Vehicle Minimum Sound Testing
_________________________________________________________
 
**Publication date:** June 15, 2023
**Deadline for submission:** July 11, 2023, at 14:00
**Expected start date:** August 1, 2023
**Expected end date:** March 31, 2025

**Background:**

As part of the Canada Motor Vehicle Safety Standards, Transport Canada requires the minimum sound level for hybrid and electric vehicles to be tested and regulated. This, in turn, aims to enhance the safety and awareness of vulnerable road users, such as pedestrians and cyclists.

**Tender:**

Transport Canada is issuing a request for proposal (RFP) to contract for professional services related to the minimum sound testing of hybrid and electric vehicles. The scope of the contract includes:

1. Laboratory compliance testing for vehicles under Canada Motor Vehicle Safety Standard (CMVSS) 141.
2. Unbiased vehicle minimum sound research testing on an expanded scope of vehicles, including conventionally powered, hybrid, and electric; medium and heavy-duty vehicles.

**Technical Requirements:**

The contractor will be required to perform testing and research to a standard of either UN ECE Regulations No. 138 or CFR Standard No. 141. The contractor must also provide evidence of experience and capability in performing similar services.

**Duration and Contract Period:**

The contract term will be 2 years, with an option to extend by 1 year. The expected start date is August 1, 2023, and the expected end date is March 31, 2025.

**Trade Agreements:**

This tender is open under the Canada-Chile Free Trade Agreement, North American Free Trade Agreement, Canada-Honduras Free Trade Agreement, Comprehensive and Progressive Agreement for Trans-Pacific Partnership, Canada-Panama Free Trade Agreement, Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement, Canada-Peru Free Trade Agreement, Canada-Ukraine Free Trade Agreement, Canada-Korea Free Trade Agreement, Canada-Colombia Free Trade Agreement, and the World Trade Organization-Agreement on Government Procurement.

**Eligibility and Selection Criteria:**

Eligible contractors must demonstrate relevant experience and technical capability. The selection process will be based on a combined rating of technical merit and price.

**Contact Information:**

For more information or to submit a bid, please contact:
